Literature.Title: Thaulin-1: The first antimicrobial peptide isolated from the skin of a Patagonian frog Pleurodema thaul (Anura: Leptodactylidae: Leiuperinae) with activity against Escherichia coli.
Literature.Author: Marani MM, et al.

Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: Human erythrocytes:0% Hemolysis=125 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:10% Hemolysis=250 µg/ml,Human erythrocytes:85% Hemolysis=500 µg/ml
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MIC=500µg/ml),Staphylococcus aureus ATCC 29213(MBC=500µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MIC=62.5µg/ml),Escherichia coli ATCC 25922(MBC=62.5µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MIC=125µg/ml),Klebsiella pneumoniae ATCC 700603(MBC=125µg/ml),Leishmania infantum MHOM/MA/67/ITMAP-263(IC50=>128µg/ml)
